expected:
employees = pd.read_sql('SELECT * FROM employees', conn)
result = employees[employees['department'] == 'Sales']

input: SELECT name, salary FROM employees WHERE salary > 50000 ORDER BY salary DESC;
expected:
employees = pd.read_sql('SELECT * FROM employees', conn)
result = employees[employees['salary'] > 50000][['name', 'salary']].sort_values(by='salary', ascending=False)

input: SELECT department, COUNT(*) FROM employees GROUP BY department;
expected:
employees = pd.read_sql('SELECT * FROM employees', conn)
result = employees.groupby('department').size().reset_index(name='count')

input: SELECT AVG(salary) FROM employees WHERE department = 'Engineering';
expected:
employees = pd.read_sql('SELECT * FROM employees', conn)
result = employees[employees['department'] == 'Engineering']['salary'].mean()

input: SELECT e.name, d.name FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department_id = d.id;
expected:
employees = pd.read_sql('SELECT * FROM employees', conn)
departments = pd.read_sql('SELECT * FROM departments', conn)
result = employees.merge(departments, left_on='department_id', right_on='id')[['name_x', 'name_y']].rename(columns={'name_x': 'e.name', 'name_y': 'd.name'})
